text:
Hi all, I've got a somewhat basic question regarding themes and styles - for context I am more on the marketeer than the developer side when it comes to HubSpot CMS.
The font type, size, and colour for error messages on form submission are - if they don't appear in Theme Settings - hard coded in the template, right?
If that is the case where and how would I find the styling in a theme?

Hello folks, Our client wants to change the template (marketplace) of some LPs to a custom theme. However, when changing the template from content staging, *even when selecting a blank template*, the template brings the CSS from the previous theme, creating a conflict with the new template. Does anyone know which configurations or files we can modify to avoid this behavior? Thank you!

a few things to check:

was CSS added to the site header HTML?

is there a stylesheet attached to the domain?

any page head HTML or stylsheets in advanced settings?
Aha! Solved the problem. Thank you <@U03AKL6Q1B2>!
you're welcome <@U05PH16KJ79> glad you could get it working!

Hi <@U03AKL6Q1B2> was CSS added to the site header HTML? No.

is there a stylesheet attached to the domain? No.

any page head HTML or stylsheets in advanced settings? No, only tracking codes

Hi <@U04BA0MMTFB> interesting...ok, and when you create the staged blank page, it is from an entirely new custom theme with it's own templates, or was the template added to the existing theme?

Are the old theme and new theme similarly named? this is somewhat tricky to troubleshoot without seeing design tools directly - is the new theme a child theme of the old?

<@U03AKL6Q1B2> Yes is a new theme, completed created by agency, with own templates.
The themes are differents named, the old template is the "Starter" template "Compass", I can see the code, but the files is not located on the design manager. I canÂ´t create a child theme for Compass
hmm ok - and when you created the blank staged page, you're seeing code from the old theme?
this is certainly strange and might be worth submitting a ticket to HubSpot support - since they can review the portal directly, they can isolate where the conflict with the CSS is coming from
